title: Human-Rights Groups Worry U.N. is Bowing to Beijing Over Xinjiang
sub_head: Letter signed by nearly 200 groups demands release of long-delayed report as U.N. human-rights head plans visit to China
body:
TAIPEI—Concern has grown among human-rights groups that the United Nations is deferring to Beijing in its response to the campaign of forcible assimilation Chinese authorities are carrying out against ethnic minorities in the country’s Xinjiang region.
A coalition of 192 human-rights organizations issued an open letter on Tuesday calling on the U.N. to publish a long-delayed report on Chinese government actions targeting Uyghurs and other Turkic Muslim groups in Xinjiang.
